description.narrative: GGF funds will support the African Biodiversity Network to increase bio cultural resilience through the application of community research on bio cultural issues. ABN will help to develop the capacity for community research groups and will support the groups to hold dialogue meetings with community elders to identify and revitalize practices for the use of diverse seeds that have been undermined by the promotion of monoculture. It will support communities to draw seed maps and eco calendars to help develop strategies for action to protect community seeds. ABN will help document the disaggregated gender based knowledge and responsibilities around seed work to share with other communities outside the network. Research will help to establish farmers markets and investigate how bio cultural diversity contributes to food sovereignty in Africa.
